info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 27 at 3:10AM EST until February 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Tioga county. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 1 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute today or the Tuesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will move in early this evening and quickly produce heavy snowfall rates up to 1 inch per hour until midnight. The combination of snow and some sleet or freezing rain mixing in and gusty winds with blowing snow will create hazardous travel conditions with slippery roads likely. The snow will be wet with a high water content...making shoveling very difficult. The snow will taper off Tuesday morning before ending in the afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
